title: Chair, ca. 1785
description: Shield back side chair with a splat composed of three open blade-forms; cusped on their interiors and separated under the top rail by two blossoms.  The forms merge into a fluted spreading panel at their base.  Its legs are straight, square, and tapered in the front on square feet.  The seat is shaped, hollowed, and upholstered in black-painted canvas (possibly the original upholstery).

tombstone.epitaph:
Chair, ca. 1785.
ca. 1785. Carved mahogany. Gift of George A. Hearn. 1900-25-7.
